intro: Spermacoce bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Spermacoce bogotensis is often found in montane ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
